Unnamed: 8: Ensure healthy lives and promote wellbeing for all at all ages.

Unnamed: 10: \nBy 2020, halve the number of global deaths and injuries from road traffic accidents\n
Unnamed: 11: \n3.6.1 Death rate due to road traffic injuries
Unnamed: 12: MinRes has completed a test pilot of an autonomous 330 tonne payload road train in the Yilgarn region. MinRes will commence mobilisation at our Ashburton Hub. This will take drivers off the road and reduce the number of deaths and injuries from road traffic accidents.

Unnamed: 10: \nAchieve universal health coverage, including financial risk protection, access to quality essential health-care services and access to safe, effective, quality and affordable essential medicines and vaccines for all\n
Unnamed: 11: \n3.8.2 Proportion of population with large household expenditures on health as a share of total household expenditure or income
Unnamed: 12: MinRes offers a number of health and wellbeing services to employees. These include, mental health services through our Employee Assistance Program (EAP) provider and in-house psychologist, an on-site medical centre at the Perth corporate office along with coaching and training in first aid, mental health first aid and employee wellbeing.

Unnamed: 11: \n3.8.1 Coverage of essential health services\n

Unnamed: 10: \nBy 2030, substantially reduce the number of deaths and illnesses from hazardous chemicals and air, water and soil pollution and contamination
Unnamed: 11: \n3.9.1 Mortality rate attributed to household and ambient air pollution
Unnamed: 12: MinRes has a comprehensive approach to water resource management, encompassing water audits, enhanced water efficiency, and compliance with industry standards. These initiatives collectively contribute to the SDG indicator's objective of minimising illnesses linked to compromised water and inadequate sanitation, thereby promoting responsible and sustainable water practices.

Unnamed: 11: \n3.9.2 Mortality rate attributed to unsafe water, unsafe sanitation and lack of hygiene (exposure to unsafe Water, Sanitation and Hygiene for All (WASH) services)
\n3.9.3 Mortality rate attributed to unintentional poisoning\n

Unnamed: 8: Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all.

Unnamed: 10: By 2030, ensure equal access for all women and men to affordable and quality technical, vocational and tertiary education, including university
Unnamed: 11: \n4.3.1 Participation rate of youth and adults in formal and non-formal education and training in the previous 12 months, by sex\n
Unnamed: 12: MinRes has made significant strides toward achieving equal access to quality education by partnering with Curtin University and establishing the Moorditj Yorga Scholarship for Indigenous Australian women. The NextGen Scholar program further demonstrates our commitment, empowering students in essential technical disciplines and fostering future industry leaders.
Unnamed: 13: Community & Stakeholder Relationships\n\nAttracting and Retaining Talent

Unnamed: 8: Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls.

Unnamed: 10: End all forms of discrimination against all women and girls everywhere
Unnamed: 11: 5.1.1 Whether or not legal frameworks are in place to promote, enforce and monitor equality and non-discrimination on the basis of sex
Unnamed: 12: MinRes has taken steps to fulfill this requirement by enacting a Diversity and Inclusion Policy, aiming to reduce various forms of discrimination against women in our operations.

Unnamed: 11: \n5.5.1 Proportion of seats held by women in (a) national parliaments and (b) local governments\n
Unnamed: 12: MinRes has taken steps to fulfill this requirement by enacting a Diversity and Inclusion Policy, aiming to reduce various forms of discrimination against women in our operations.\n\nAdditionally, we disclose the proportion of women in managerial positions within the 2023 Sustainability Performance Tables.

Unnamed: 8: Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all.

Unnamed: 10: By 2030, achieve universal and equitable access to safe and affordable drinking water for all
Unnamed: 11: 6.1.1 Proportion of population using safely managed drinking water services
Unnamed: 12: By implementing monitoring, compliance measures, and operational plans that cover water usage, quality, and protection, we promote responsible water management across our mining operations.

Unnamed: 10: By 2030, improve water quality by reducing pollution, eliminating dumping and minimizing release of hazardous chemicals and materials, halving the proportion of untreated wastewater and substantially increasing recycling and safe reuse globally
Unnamed: 11: 6.3.1 Proportion of wastewater safely treated
Unnamed: 12: MinRes minimises the release of hazardous substances, encouraging recycling and safe reuse, and adopting responsible wastewater treatment practices.

Unnamed: 11: 6.3.2 Proportion of bodies of water with good ambient water quality

Unnamed: 10: By 2030, substantially increase water-use efficiency across all sectors and ensure sustainable withdrawals and supply of freshwater to address water scarcity and substantially reduce the number of people suffering from water scarcity
Unnamed: 11: 6.4.1 Change in water-use efficiency over time
Unnamed: 12: MinRes is focused on enhancing water-use efficiency throughout our operations by implementing water consumption practices and adopting sustainable withdrawal methods.

Unnamed: 11: 6.4.2 Level of water stress: freshwater withdrawal as a proportion of available freshwater resources\n

Unnamed: 8: Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all.

Unnamed: 10: By 2030, increase substantially the share of renewable energy in the global energy mix
Unnamed: 11: 7.2.1 Renewable energy share in the total final energy consumption
Unnamed: 12: MinRes aims to increase the role of renewable energy in the global energy mix by 2030. We are focusing on reducing diesel reliance, incorporating natural gas, and investing in emission reduction initiatives and innovative solutions like autonomous road trains to align with sustainability goals.

Unnamed: 8: Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all.

Unnamed: 10: By 2030, achieve full and productive employment and decent work for all women and men, including for young people and persons with disabilities, and equal pay for work of equal value
Unnamed: 11: 8.5.1 Average hourly earnings of female and male employees, by occupation, age and persons with disabilities
Unnamed: 12: MinRes has demonstrated ongoing improvement in the participation of women and young people within our workforce and aims to create an environment that ensures equitable opportunities and fair compensation.

Unnamed: 10: Protect labour rights and promote safe and secure working environments for all workers, including migrant workers, in particular women migrants, and those in precarious employment
Unnamed: 11: 8.8.1 Fatal and non-fatal occupational injuries per 100,000 workers, by sex and migrant status
Unnamed: 12: MinRes has a strong track record of safety and wellbeing within the workplace and continues to improve key safety performance metrics such as Total Recordable Injury Frequency Rate (TRIFR).

Unnamed: 11: 8.8.2 Level of national compliance with labour rights (freedom of association and collective bargaining) based on International Labour Organization (ILO) textual sources and national legislation, by sex and migrant status

Unnamed: 8: Reduce inequality within and among countries.

Unnamed: 10: By 2030, empower and promote the social, economic and political inclusion of all, irrespective of age, sex, disability, race, ethnicity, origin, religion or economic or other status.
Unnamed: 11: 10.2.1 Proportion of people living below 50 per cent of median income, disaggregated by age, sex and persons with disabilities.
Unnamed: 12: MinRes has a Diversity and Inclusion Policy which commits to foster diversity and inclusion at all levels of the organisation, regardless of gender identity, nationality, marital or family status, sexual orientation, age, disability or impairment, Indigenous Australian identity, ethnicity, cultural background, religious beliefs, political conviction, union membership, socio-economic background, perspective, or life experience.

Unnamed: 8: Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable.

Unnamed: 11: 11.4.1 Total per capita expenditure on the preservation, protection and conservation of all cultural and natural heritage, by source of funding (public, private), type of heritage (cultural, natural) and level of government (national, regional, and local/municipal).
Unnamed: 12: MinRes has an Indigenous People's Policy which outlines our commitment to respect and work with local Indigenous groups. MinRes is committed to ensuring compliance with all relevant legislation and regulations concerning the preservation and protection of cultural heritage.

Unnamed: 10: By 2030, provide universal access to safe, inclusive and accessible, green and public spaces, in particular for women and children, older persons and persons with disabilities.
Unnamed: 11: 11.7.2 Proportion of persons victim of physical or sexual harassment, by sex, age, disability status and place of occurrence, in the previous 12 months.
Unnamed: 12: MinRes has created and implemented a bespoke Safe and Respectful Behaviours training program delivered to 100 per cent of the workforce as at 30 June 2023. This was implemented to educate staff on the requirements of all employees to create a safe and respectful workplace.

Unnamed: 8: Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss.

Unnamed: 10: By 2020, combat desertification, restore degraded land and soil, including land affected by desertification, drought and floods, and strive to achieve a land- degradation-neutral world.
Unnamed: 11: 15.3.1 Proportion of land that is degraded over total land area.
Unnamed: 12: MinRes has an Environment Policy which outlines our commitment to integrate rehabilitation and closure considerations throughout all stages of our activities to transition to closure effectively.

Unnamed: 10: Take urgent and significant action to reduce the degradation of natural habitats, halt the loss of biodiversity, and, by 2020, protect and prevent the extinction of threatened species.
Unnamed: 11: 15.5.1 Red List Index.
Unnamed: 12: MinRes discloses the biodiversity status and species per the IUCN Red List related to the regions in which we operate. MinRes also discloses its biodiversity performance on an ongoing basis within our Sustainability Report.

Unnamed: 8: Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the global partnership for sustainable development.

Unnamed: 12: MinRes has a number of partnerships spanning governments, Indigenous groups, communities and other stakeholders. These partnerships are important to effective and collaborative relationships between MinRes and its stakeholders.
